intro: Heladena biglandulosa, commonly known as the woolly heladena, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant is distinguished by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting various pollinators. Heladena biglandulosa is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
